symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests
diagnoses: Myeloproliferative neoplasms (e.g., Essential thrombocythemia, Polycythemia vera)

Inflammatory and autoimmune conditions (e.g., Sarcoidosis, Vasculitis, Behcets disease)
Drug-induced (e.g., Medications that can cause thrombocytosis or leukoplakia)
Hypersomnia associated with a medical or psychiatric disorder
Autoimmune disorders (e.g., lupus, juvenile idiopathic arthritis)
Leukopenia (as a separate issue, causes to be investigated)
Nutritional deficiencies (e.g., vitamin B12 deficiency, folate deficiency)
Certain autoimmune diseases (e.g., lupus, rheumatoid arthritis)
Neurological disorders (e.g., Parkinsons disease, restless legs syndrome)
Connective tissue disorders (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus)

Sjögrens Syndrome (when it affects the nervous system)
